creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: image, circumscribed by an oval, of a bridge with two figures at R talking; smaller figure crossing bridge on L side; hills, stone building in background
inscription: in graphite on verso: Swanevelt BII:6 | APG 9222
portfolio: From From Variae Campestrium Fantasiae, Plate 5
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York; sold November 10, 1987, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
text: Herman van Swanevelt was born in the Netherlands, but his ten years in Italy forever stamped his landscapes with bright southern light. In this tiny vignette, the diagonal hatching on the rocks and mountains seems to sweep the two travelers toward the old bridge.
title: A Stone Bridge, From Variae Campestrium Fantasiae, Plate 5
